text:
Annasif Døhlen (23 June 1930 – 5 January 2021) was a Norwegian painter and sculptor. She was born in Stavanger, Norway. She was known for her portraits of Johan Scharffenberg, Håkon Bleken and David Monrad Johansen, and a sculpture of Olav V of Norway, which is at the Holmenkollen ski arena.
She was represented in the National Gallery of Norway and Riksgalleriet.
Døhlen died on 5 January 2021, aged 90.
